newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: More than 20 killed in combat across Colombia.
newsitem.headline: More than 20 killed in combat across Colombia.

text.p: More than 20 soldiers and guerrillas were killed in a weekend of battles pitting Colombia's leftist rebels against government troops, authorities said on Monday.

National Police and army high command reports said the worst attack came on Sunday in northeastern Arauca province where a rebel bomb, made from 110 pounds (50 kg) of dynamite, killed four policemen and left seven people seriously injured.
The military blamed National Liberation Army (ELN) rebels for the bomb, which exploded inside a pickup truck. ELN landmines also killed two policemen in Norte de Santander province on Saturday.
Three other policemen and at least one soldier were killed in other fighting and authorities said at least 11 were killed between Sunday night and Monday morning.

The ELN continued its dynamite attacks on Monday morning, blowing up a gas and oil pipeline in the northern oil production centre of Barrancabermeja. A police station in the oil town also fell under attack, army officials said.
The ELN, Colombia's second-largest guerrilla group, was founded by radical Roman Catholic priests in the mid-1960s and specialises in kidnappings and a nationwide campaign of economic sabotage.
